thread.title: With Help From Kickstarter, Chicago Gets a Museum That Relishes the Hot Dog
thread.title_full: With Help From Kickstarter, Chicago Gets a Museum That Relishes the Hot Dog - The New York Times

author: Matt Beardmore
title: With Help From Kickstarter, Chicago Gets a Museum That Relishes the Hot Dog
text:
Foodseum opens its first exhibition, “The Hot Dog and Encased Meat of the World,” on Saturday at Block 37 in Chicago ’s Loop; it runs through Dec. 20.
The free pop-up food museum was financed through a Kickstarter campaign last year that raised more than $33,000.
“Because we are a Chicago-based organization, we wanted to do something as a tribute to our city,” said Kyle Joseph, the executive director of Foodseum. “The hot dog is very core to the city.”
The interactive exhibit, which Mr. Joseph said was designed to “inspire people and open people’s minds to the foods we eat,” will have three major components: the history of hot dogs and encased meats, international flavors (including a smell station), and farm to fork, which will showcase the steps needed to make the meats.
Foodseum will be open Wednesday through Sunday from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m.
It is not the only museum news in the city.
